column3: Http proxy used for NuGet HTTP operations.
column4: This would be specified as http://<username>:<password>@proxy.com .

column3: Configures domains to bypass from using proxy.
column4: Specified as domains separated by comma (,).

column3: Flag for if NuGet should implicitly grant consent if that's required by package on restore.
column4: Specified flag is treated as true or 1 , any other value treated as flag not set.

column3: Prevents the exe for prompting for credentials.
column4: Any value except null or empty string will be treated as this flag set/true.

column3: Global environment variable to force interactive mode.
column4: Any value except null or empty string will be treated as this flag set/true.

column3: Path to use for the global-packages folder as described on Managing the global packages and cache folders .

column4: Absolute folder paths separated by semicolon (;).

column3: Path to use for the http-cache folder as described on Managing the global packages and cache folders .
Flag indicating if dg files (data collected from MSBuild) should be persisted.
column4: Specified as true or false (default), if NUGET_PERSIST_DG_PATH not set will be stored to temporary directory (NuGetScratch folder in current environment temp directory).
Specified as absolute path, this option is only used when NUGET_PERSIST_DG is set to true.
Pass arguments identical to how you would pass them to msbuild.exe. An example of setting a project property Foo from the command line to value Bar would be /p:Foo=Bar
Default is quiet ("/v:q"). Possible values q[uiet] , m[inimal] , n[ormal] , d[etailed] , and diag[nostic] .

column3: Determines whether the full exception (including stack trace) should be displayed to the user.
Determines how assemblies XML documentation file extraction should be handled.
column4: Supported modes are skip (do not extract XML documentation files), compress (store XML doc files as a zip archive) or none (default, treat XML doc files as regular files).

column3: Determines how the revocation status check of the certificate used to sign a package, is performed when a signed package is installed or restored. When not set, defaults to online .
column4: Possible values online (default), offline . Related to NU3028
